contentrichtext.text: {{nutshell|Just use <nowiki>[[zh:]]</nowiki>. The old tags <nowiki>[[zh-cn:]]</nowiki> and/or <nowiki>[[zh-tw:]]</nowiki> are defunct.}} The Chinese within the <nowiki>[[zh:]]</nowiki> tag could be either Traditional or Simplified. It doesn't matter. Whether the user sees Traditional or Simplified is theoretically determined by his choice of user interface in his own Preferences. ==Interlanguage Interwiki links== {{See|Help:Interwiki linking#Technical|Help:Interlanguage links]]}} In Interwiki linking, in the case of linking to another Wiki project, but involving another language, such as linking from en.wikipedia to a Chinese language source on Wikisource, this may be done by first putting the project link target, then a colon followed by the target language as a prefix to the article page name, in the form: :<tt><nowiki>[[projectname:languagecode:articlename]]</nowiki></tt>. For example, to link from en.Wikipedia to a Chinese language text at Wikisource (zh.wikisource): :Type: <tt><nowiki>[[wikisource:zh:天問]]</nowiki></tt> :To get: [[wikisource:zh:天問]] :Type: <tt><nowiki>[[wikisource:zh:天問|天問]]</nowiki></tt> :To get: [[wikisource:zh:天問|天問]] :Type: <tt><nowiki>[[wikisource:zh:天問|Heavenly Questions]]</nowiki></tt> :To get: [[wikisource:zh:天問|Heavenly Questions]] These 3 examples all resolve to the zh.wikisource page [http://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A9%E5%95%8F 天問], but without the misleading and distracting appearance of being an external link.
